To date, several studies have addressed the possible impacts of climate change on maize, mostly at the regional level and focusing on changes in productivity. Some studies have indicated that temperature increases have a negative effect on maize yield, whereas CO 2 increases could be beneficial for changes in water availability. However, the level of uncertainty in the CO 2 results has been consistently high in all research studies
